author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Election Commission will maintain a “special vigil” in the Left Wing Extremism (LWE) affected areas of West Bengal to thwart any untoward incident.

The decision came after Deputy Election Commissioner Sandeep Saxena held a meeting with district magistrates, superintendents of police and State EC officials on Tuesday.

“This is being done to keep the Assembly Elections incident free. As for the LWE areas we have been instructed to be very alert,” Dibyendu Sarkar additional Chief Electoral Officer told journalists. He also said that the central team of EC had asked them to maintain a special vigil along interstate borders especially Purulia district.
title: EC for incident-free polls in West Bengal
